about.title: About {{ProductFullName}} API
about.content: [{{ProductFullName}}]({{ProductUrl}}) is a advanced .NET API to electronically sign digital documents using various signature types such as text, image, barcode, QR-code, stamp, form-field and metadata. Users can load, edit, validate, save, remove, preview and search digital signatures within PDF, Microsoft Word, Excel worksheets, PowerPoint presentations, Adobe Photoshop, metafiles and image file formats, with additional support for customizing signature properties as needed.

overview.description1: Sign your {{FILEFORMAT}} files with {{SIGNATURETYPE}} signatures using {{ProductName}} easily. You can use just a couple of {{ProgLang}} code lines in any platform of your choice like - Windows, Linux, macOS.
overview.description2: You can put {{SIGNATURETYPE}} on {{FILEFORMAT}} file in a very convenient way and for free. Besides that it is possible to sign {{FILEFORMAT}} files using advanced {{SIGNATURETYPE}} options.
overview.sign_options_desc: There are a lot of options features to sign {{FILEFORMAT}} which you may use for your purposes:
overview.sign_options_item_1: {{SIGNATURETYPE}} position on the page can be set up as absolutely as relatively;
overview.sign_options_item_2: One {{SIGNATURETYPE}} signature may be placed on specified pages of multi-page documents;
overview.sign_options_item_3: A lot of additional signature features like color, size, border etc. are available.
overview.sign_saving_desc: There are also saving options for signed {{FILEFORMAT}} file:
overview.sign_saving_item_1: after signing file might be saved with other supported format
overview.sign_saving_item_2: furthermore file can be encrypted with password or saved to memory stream
overview.summary: Signing {{FILEFORMAT}} files with {{SIGNATURETYPE}} provides vast amount opportunities for users. Moreover there is no need for any additional software installed - like MS Office, Open Office, Adobe Acrobat Reader etc.
